intro: Cheiranthus pumilio, commonly known as the rock scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cheiranthus pumilio is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in mountainous areas across Europe and parts of Asia.
